alert.note: Alert for Butler; Clermont; Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON, SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER, NORTH CENTRAL CLERMONT AND SOUTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 456 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Trenton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Lebanon, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Montgomery, South Middletown, West Chester, Kings Island, Sixteen Mile Stand, Olde West Chester, Four Bridges, Highpoint, Wetherington and Brecon. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 34. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
